icmp.eli5: ICMP is like a mailman who tells you if the letter you sent made it to the other house.
icmp.boss: ICMP is a network protocol used for diagnostic tools like ping and traceroute to check connectivity and path info.
icmp.sysadmin: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used to send error messages and operational queries—commonly seen in ping and traceroute.
icmp.use_case: Used when you ping a device to test if it's reachable on the network.

igmp.eli5: IGMP is how your computer says ‘I want to watch this video stream too!’
igmp.boss: IGMP manages group membership for devices wanting to receive multicast traffic like IPTV or conferencing.
igmp.sysadmin: The Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) is used by IPv4 hosts to join and leave multicast groups for efficient data streaming.
igmp.use_case: Used when a smart TV subscribes to a multicast video stream on a local network.

arp.eli5: ARP is like your computer looking up someone’s name to find their address.
arp.boss: ARP maps IP addresses to physical MAC addresses so devices can communicate on local networks.
arp.sysadmin: The Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) resolves IPv4 addresses to MAC addresses using broadcast queries and cache tables.
arp.use_case: Used when your device figures out the MAC address of your gateway to send data.
